oecd_gst_model.text:
OECD Model Tax Convention on Income and on Capital - Goods and Services Tax (GST) Framework

Article 1: Scope and Application
This framework shall apply to all transactions involving the supply of goods and services within the jurisdiction, pursuant to the principles of destination-based consumption taxation.

Article 2: Tax Base and Rate Structure
The tax base shall comprise the transaction value of all taxable supplies, excluding specifically exempted categories as enumerated in Schedule A. The standard rate shall be set by the competent authority within the range of 10-20% of the tax base.

Article 3: Registration and Compliance
All persons engaged in the supply of taxable goods or services with annual turnover exceeding the threshold amount shall register with the tax authority and comply with return filing, payment, and record-keeping requirements.

Article 4: Input Tax Credit
Registered persons shall be entitled to claim input tax credit for taxes paid on inputs used in the course of taxable supplies, subject to documentation requirements and anti-avoidance provisions.

Article 5: Administration and Enforcement
The tax authority shall have powers of assessment, audit, investigation, and penalty imposition to ensure compliance with this framework. Appeals procedures shall be established in accordance with natural justice principles.

Schedule A: Exempted Supplies (to be specified by domestic legislation)
Schedule B: Zero-Rated Supplies (exports and specified categories)

world_bank_regulatory.text:
World Bank Model Regulatory Framework for Business Operations

Section 1: Regulatory Objectives
This regulatory framework aims to facilitate business operations while protecting public interest, consumer rights, environmental sustainability, and fair competition.

Section 2: Licensing and Permits
All businesses operating within the jurisdiction shall obtain necessary licenses and permits from the designated regulatory authority. The authority shall establish transparent, time-bound procedures for application processing.

Section 3: Regulatory Standards
Businesses shall comply with minimum standards for product safety, environmental protection, labor rights, consumer protection, and anti-corruption measures as specified in subordinate regulations.

Section 4: Monitoring and Inspection
The regulatory authority shall conduct periodic inspections and monitoring to ensure compliance. Inspection procedures shall be risk-based, proportionate, and conducted with minimal disruption to business operations.

Section 5: Enforcement and Penalties
Non-compliance shall result in graduated sanctions including warnings, fines, license suspension, or revocation, depending on severity and recurrence. Appeal mechanisms shall be available.

Section 6: Regulatory Review
This framework shall be subject to periodic review every three years to assess effectiveness, efficiency, and continued relevance.

Annex I: Sector-Specific Requirements (to be developed)
Annex II: Fee Schedule (to be determined by competent authority)

constitutional_amendment.text:
Constitutional Amendment Procedure - Model Framework

Article 1: Amendment Initiation
Proposals for constitutional amendment may be initiated by: (a) one-third of members of the national legislature; (b) the executive authority with legislative endorsement; or (c) popular petition meeting prescribed signature thresholds.

Article 2: Deliberation Process
Proposed amendments shall undergo thorough deliberation including committee review, public consultations, and expert testimony. A minimum deliberation period of six months shall be observed.

Article 3: Approval Requirements
Constitutional amendments shall require approval by: (a) two-thirds majority of the national legislature in two separate sessions; and (b) ratification by three-fifths of sub-national legislative bodies or direct popular vote with simple majority.

Article 4: Entrenchment Clauses
Certain fundamental provisions including democratic principles, human rights guarantees, and federal structure shall not be subject to amendment, or shall require enhanced procedures including national referendum.

Article 5: Promulgation and Effect
Approved amendments shall be promulgated by the head of state and shall take effect upon publication or on a date specified in the amendment text.

Article 6: Judicial Review
The constitutional court shall have jurisdiction to review the procedural validity of amendments and ensure compliance with entrenchment clauses.

Transitional Provisions: (to be specified in amendment text)
